Providence.Brick Schoolhouse:
The Brick Schoolhouse (also known as the Meeting Street School or Providence Preservation Society) is a historic colonial meeting house and school at 24 Meeting Street in the College Hill neighborhood of Providence, Rhode Island.


== History ==
The school was built in 1768 to serve as a school and meeting place for town meetings. The building temporarily housed the college that became Brown University when it moved from Warren to Providence in 1770.
